column4: can someone please help me? i am having trouble connecting to the internet in ubuntu
broadband
when trying to use my web browser to search google i got the following error " unable to connect to server"
it might be ur dns
i do not know how to ping my router
what should ifcongfig tell me?
ifconfig and check ur gateway
check for what?
ifconfig tells u a lots, hwaddress, ip, gateway ip too
what should i do with that information?
if u can ip, and gateway, try ping that gateway ip
what should i do if it does not respond? i am having to log back into windows to get help with this, so i would like to cover all my bases
if u can ping, then u need to check ur dns. and change /etc/resolv.conf to point to ur dns. are u using ubuntu by now?
i have used ubuntu before but i am installing it now on a friend's computer.
emmm.... so ur fren comp besides ur com now?
how do i check my dns?
no, i am at her house installing it on her computer, mine is at home
surface; how do i find out what her dns address is?
emm... u need to check the router... where are u from , i mean country.
united states, why?
wat isp are u using, ask around here and see whether any one knows
you said i should make sure /etc/resolve.conf matches my dns address, how do i do that?
i guess i will go try that now
209.131.36.158 < --- this is yahoo ip, if u login to ubuntu and able to ping this. that means u need to change ur /etc/resolve.conf to point to ur dns
